history.content:
I believe both answers are no. This was found on the FAQ page https://eecs.berkeley.edu/academics/graduate/industry-programs/5yrms/faq

I'd like to take some time off between completing my bachelor's degree and starting the master's degree. Is this possible?

No. This program will not accommodate leaves of absence. Admitted students are expected to transition immediately from the undergrad program to the grad program in order to complete the entire program in five consecutive years. You are encouraged to apply to any of our other graduate programs if you would like to take time off.

Additionally, in order to be eligible for the 5th Yr MS program you MUST have graduated in the Fall term before or be on the Spring degree list in your final year as an undergraduate.

children.subject: yes (I'm assuming you mean applying for the 2021-2022 year)- thats what I did in 2020!
If I am graduating in summer 2021, am I eligible to apply to 5-year master?

history.content:
1. If you get in, can you defer admission by a year? If yes, can you attend another 1 year masters program at another institution in that year?

2. Can you apply for this program after you have graduated? i.e. one year after undergrad

I know these are strange questions but they're relevant to my situation. I have emailed the department many times but got no response.
history.subject: 5th Year Master
